intro: Scorzonera aniana, commonly known as the Armenian scurvy grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of the Caucasus and Central Asia, where it thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in the summer, and its leaves are characterized by their hairy texture and lobed shape. Scorzonera aniana is also known for its edible roots, which have been used in traditional medicine and cuisine. Its ecological role includes supporting pollinators and stabilizing soil in its native habitats.
